block.p: Rachel Marie Leanza and Hettihanthrige Sanith Wijesinghe were married yesterday at Forest Park in Woodhaven, Queens. The Rev. Laurie Sue Brockway, an interfaith minister, officiated.

Ms. Leanza, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of alumni affairs at the Browning School in Manhattan and is in her second year of study toward a master's degree in music education at the City University of New York. She graduated from Temple University and received a master's degree in vocal performance from the San Francisco Conservatory of Music.
Rachel Marie Leanza and Hettihanthrige Sanith Wijesinghe were married yesterday at Forest Park in Woodhaven, Queens. The Rev. Laurie Sue Brockway, an interfaith minister, officiated.
Rachel Marie Leanza and Hettihanthrige Sanith Wijesinghe were married yesterday at Forest Park in Woodhaven, Queens. The Rev. Laurie Sue Brockway, an interfaith minister, officiated.

Ms. Leanza, 31, is keeping her name. She is the director of alumni affairs at the Browning School in Manhattan and is in her second year of study toward a master's degree in music education at the City University of New York. She graduated from Temple University and received a master's degree in vocal performance from the San Francisco Conservatory of Music.

She is a daughter of Elizabeth and Patrick Leanza of Ballston Spa, N.Y. Her father, who is retired, was a coordinator of data security at the office of the New York State comptroller in Albany. Her mother is a reference librarian at Saratoga Springs Public Library in New York.

Mr. Wijesinghe, 33, works in Jersey City, as a software designer at Millennium Information Technologies, a developer of software for the financial services industry, which is based in Malabe, Sri Lanka. He graduated from the Imperial College London and received both master's and doctorate degrees in aeronautics and astronautics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology.
He is the son of Nanda Wijesinghe and Dr. Dharmapriya Wijesinghe of Padukka, Sri Lanka. His father is a geriatrician in Padukka.
